channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2025030062
item.description:
Report X-2025030062

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: Little Rock
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated when they were unloading they noticed a 55 Gal drum had been punctured causing a roughly 2 Gallon spill onto the trailer floor and yard. ABF stated there is no storm drains or waterways effected. Loading error at 064/DAY.

item.title: Report I-2025020063
item.description:
Report I-2025020063

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T00:52:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During unloading operations into the facility storage tank the storage tank pump being used failed causing product release into retention area of tank. Operations halted and pump replaced. Unloading completed withOut additional incident. Facility personnel cleaned released material.
